name: Aggie Grey's Lagoon, Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.title: Standards have dropped since our last visit
reviews.text: We've stayed here before attending a work conference and was treated to a fantasticly run resort. Unfortunately on our return for a holiday with the family we have found things to have slipped.

reviews.title: Junk
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet for one has dropped in quality but still ok as an inclusive offering with your room. Food prices have remained pretty much the same as our first visit but as mentioned in other reviews there is an over abundance of deep fried food on the menu.

reviews.title: You'd have to drag me kicking and screaming to get me back there
reviews.text: The rooms are just in need of a spruce up, evident of quiet times and little to spend on maintainence.

reviews.title: Overpriced, underperforming
reviews.text: As with most resorts it's the little things that spoil it, if they fixed/addressed these we would be back, as it's a great setting.

reviews.title: tired resort, island time staff and deep fried hell
reviews.text: Just got back from 10 days in Samoa, this was our last stop for our final 3 nights and wanted to be close to the airport for covenience. If you go to Samoa, go directly to the Savai'i Lagoon Resort and spend your last night (only) here i if you have to. The food was barely edible and only got eaten because there was nowhere else to go. The staff were indifferent and I suspect this is because they are either micro or mismanaged, no genuine smiles or talofas when passing them during the day. Resort was filled with families and other tourists who seemed to be going through the motions. Nothing special here, and what rip-off prices. Stock up on duty free in AKL before leaving. Bring snacks, because did I mention, the food is terrible. The only outstanding staff member was the lady on the egg/omlette station in the morning, she was great! (June 9th-11th).

reviews.title: Better than I expected
reviews.text: I stayed at this Aggie Greys for one night before returning home. I thought the facilities and my room were fine... lovely pool area and a few different restaurants to eat at. I had a very relaxing massage at the spa. It is expensive, but you get that at a resort like this.

reviews.title: Pristine Pacific outlooks ... and bacon
reviews.text: It was our first time to Samoa and we had a very relaxing time here. The accommodation options in Samoa are quite limited so this one will inevitably be on your list to consider if you’re coming to Samoa.

reviews.title: Island Relaxation and Culture
reviews.text: The rooms are of a good, clean standard. Grounds are well-maintained and cared for. The locals and staff are extremely friendly, and welcoming.

reviews.title: Surprisingly Better than Expectations
reviews.text: The food as part of the all-inclusive stay option might be a struggle for some. It’s hearty and healthy fare but not of a gourmet standard by any means. The locally caught tuna was excellent but you may tire of it after a few nights in a row as we did. If they could cook it anything but well-done it might be better, but then again you’re not sure about how long it’s been sitting about – probably less time than it would in a usual market, but it still raises questions. Anyway, the tuna is always well-done.

reviews.title: Beautiful location
reviews.text: There other options of course, Euro and local, but overall the food was of standard quality so you shouldn’t expect a gourmet experience.

My sister and I stayed at Aggie Grey's Resort for 3 nights (May 2012). Giovanni and his team were very friendly and EXTREMELY helpful.It was our first visit to Samoa and we had a few things we had no idea how to sort out and Giovanni took the time to sort it out for us. I would highly recommend Aggie Grey's Lagoon, Beach Resort & Spa to anyone travelling to Samoa! Would definately go back.

reviews.text: Thank you Giovanni and your team for a wonderful holiday experience in Samoa.

reviews.title: Not Too Bad

reviews.text: Excellent kids club for our grand-daughter. Beautiful rooms and lovely meals and all restaurants.
reviews.title: Nice resort. Pity about the food & price

reviews.text: Spa Treatment in the rain forest was a big plus. Rental vehicle arrangements all easily made and was check in/check out.
reviews.title: What you expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the name "Lagoon, Beach Resort & Spa", from the impressive sweeping grounds, from the cavernous lobby and most certainly from the heavy price, you could sensibly conclude that Aggie's Lagoon will contain only sparkling grandeur, sinfully indulgent facilities and dynastic finesse. In reality, it is merely an airport lodge on steroids. Don't feel too bad if you fall into this trap, I did, in fact, I'd booked 5 nights here, after 2 hours onsite, I made my way to the lobby and enquired about their cancellation policy (which is 24 hours notice), very quickly 5 nights become 1, and I spent my remaining 4 nights at the glorious Le Lagoto Resort, in Savai'i, in heaven.
reviews.title: Last thing I remember, I was Running for the door

reviews.text: There are many reviews saying the same exact thing. All you need to know is that there are hundreds of concrete rooms, they span thousands of feet, they're identical and they feel like they've be designed by maths professor complete with white coat and ruler. As you walk around the grounds you'll swiftly form the firm view that everything here has an odd, almost unsettling, "fakeness" about it, you almost expect the staff to be battery operated and have coin slots on the back of their necks.
reviews.title: Perfect place to relax!!

reviews.text: This hotel should be marvelled as a wonder of modern marketing, in this respect it is a first clas. In terms of accommodation, hospitality and economy you could not do any worse.
reviews.title: Pleasure Island! The Pleasure was all ours!

reviews.text: Seriously, if you're ever at a dinner party and the person sitting next to you says they once stayed at Aggies Lagoon, you should console them, if they say they've stayed there twice or more, you should shift seats.
reviews.title: Not Quite There!

reviews.text: We had such a lovely time here. The resort is beautiful! The staff and the service are first rate, everyone is so friendly and always happy to help. The restaurants are all fantastic with great food! Our top picks were the Samoan prawn curry, wood fired pizzas and the Mahi Mahi, absolutely delicious. The breakfast buffet was wonderful as well. Everyday there was lots of fresh fruit, pawpaw, pineapple, local oranges, bananas, grapefruit etc. Have seen some reviews on here where people complain because they didn't get the kind of fruit they wanted....Keep in mind the fruit is seasonal so if you want mangos everyday you will have to plan your trip in mango season! There is also heaps of other yummy stuff, fresh baked breads and pastries, taro chips, french toast, bacon etc and a chef who is more than happy to fix your eggs or omelet anyway you like!
reviews.title: Relaxing Holiday
